thread.title: Tories DEMAND Brussels returns 'iconic building' used by Thatcher as part of Brexit deal
thread.title_full: Tories DEMAND Brussels returns 'iconic building' used by Thatcher as part of Brexit deal

title: Tories DEMAND Brussels returns 'iconic building' used by Thatcher as part of Brexit deal
text:
1 of 32 Margaret Thatcher on her 84th birthday 
“I fancy perhaps the European Commission would be willing to relinquish it as they will require a substantially larger premises as a new embassy to engage with what will be one of the largest external independent neighbours.”Thatcher’s former chairman Lord Tebbit, was certainly excited by the prospect. He said: “I would love to see the Tory party take its place in the building, though I’m not sure that the Tory party these days is the party that it once was.” 
It comes as the European Union will demand Britain faces a "very hefty" Brexit divorce bill, Jean-Claude Juncker has warned.Brexit Secretary David Davis has regularly insisted both Britain’s exit agreement and future trading relationship with the EU can be negotiated and concluded within the two-year timeframe set out by Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty, the legal mechanism for departure. GETTY Jacob said the building was an emblem of the European empire in its heyday 
Although claimed Brexit talks will be “lasting and difficult” with Britain having to first agree an exit bill with the EU, with Brussels believed to ready to demand as much as £60billion, before discussing a trade deal.Sir Ivan Rogers, former UK ambassador to the EU, warned the £51million figure could be a possibility as they needed to understand "we're up against a class act with the European Commission on negotiating”. GETTY The building stood empty until 2007 when it was sold for £30.5m to Harcourt Developments 
But Craig Mackinlay, Tory MP for Thanet South, rubbished the figures being quoted and wants to see the EU’s arithmetic.He said: “I’m going to ask them where they got their figures from so we can look at them and critique them and work out whether it came from the back of a Juncker fag packet.“If you pay to join a club and leave, you don’t get saddled with future liabilities.” Related articles
